DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._The outcomes that denote an adverse event as being serious.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Adverse Event Outcome Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Adverse Event Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.
A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/9/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcomes that denote an adverse event as being serious.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event resulting in death.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event resulting in death.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

Concepts.definition: Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication or description that an adverse event is associated with or prolongs hospitalization.

Concepts.definition: An indication or description that an adverse event is associated with or prolongs hospitalization.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.

Concepts.definition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/13/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup; VD associated with CS/CSI.  jc
